body:
As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body:
No. The category feature needs to be removed until its better thought through. At this time it's a solution in search of a problem.

And I just discovered that if you categorized as a political category you are essentially shadow banned on ALL. this impacts some of the largest guilds here with the only solution to change to a non political category which tomorrow will be a violation of the ToS

post.body:
As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body:
>It's people being upset that others are being given the option to not look at them.

No, it's not. I don't agree with them entirely, but you don't have to misrepresent what they're saying...

They're upset that these categories are opt-in only. If you just look at /all without interacting with the page, there's no way to tell that some categories are hidden. There's no "Welcome to All! Go to the sidebar to choose the categories you want to see!" message, there's no description above the category list, and there's really nothing else to indicate that some categories are not visible by default. The listing's name is "All", so why wouldn't the average user assume that all categories are visible by default? There's not even a way to check these hidden categories on mobile. That's what they're upset about. They want all the categories to be opt-out (I don't necessarily agree, but that's fine), which means others *still have the option to not look at them*.

They're also upset about your response to all this. I also think it's much of an overreaction, but I dislike seeing that you're actually banning them from your guilds for making posts about this. I'm talking about @FeverDream and the others. That looks much like shutting down dissent, and it's better to just make replies saying something like "We're going to change the categorization system so it is clearer that certain categories are going to be hidden by default. We apologize for rushing the feature." or "We won't force the offensive category on any guilds, even if we do think the guild is offensive." rather than kicking the posts and banning the authors.

Also, as for the "offensive" category, they're worried about the subjectivity of the name of the category.

I'd prefer to have /all stay as a place where all guilds are visible and to have the Home feed for logged out users and a new listing (called something like "Custom") use the categorization system, but that's just my preference.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

It's people being upset that others are being given the option to not look at them.

No, it's not. I don't agree with them entirely, but you don't have to misrepresent what they're saying...

They're upset that these categories are opt-in only. If you just look at /all without interacting with the page, there's no way to tell that some categories are hidden. There's no "Welcome to All! Go to the sidebar to choose the categories you want to see!" message, there's no description above the category list, and there's really nothing else to indicate that some categories are not visible by default. The listing's name is "All", so why wouldn't the average user assume that all categories are visible by default? There's not even a way to check these hidden categories on mobile. That's what they're upset about. They want all the categories to be opt-out (I don't necessarily agree, but that's fine), which means others still have the option to not look at them.

They're also upset about your response to all this. I also think it's much of an overreaction, but I dislike seeing that you're actually banning them from your guilds for making posts about this. I'm talking about @FeverDream and the others. That looks much like shutting down dissent, and it's better to just make replies saying something like "We're going to change the categorization system so it is clearer that certain categories are going to be hidden by default. We apologize for rushing the feature." or "We won't force the offensive category on any guilds, even if we do think the guild is offensive." rather than kicking the posts and banning the authors.

Also, as for the "offensive" category, they're worried about the subjectivity of the name of the category.

I'd prefer to have /all stay as a place where all guilds are visible and to have the Home feed for logged out users and a new listing (called something like "Custom") use the categorization system, but that's just my preference.

As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

post.body:
As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body:
Yes. That's my opinion too. I think that it should be reverted and then its development made a priority for the next few weeks 

My underlying philosophy is that Ruqqus needs to cultivate a more diverse community to make it more accessible, not block out existing populations within it. One builds on Ruqqus' core values, the other is drifting in the *other* direction

parent.body:
No. The category feature needs to be removed until its better thought through. At this time it's a solution in search of a problem.

And I just discovered that if you categorized as a political category you are essentially shadow banned on ALL. this impacts some of the largest guilds here with the only solution to change to a non political category which tomorrow will be a violation of the ToS
parent.body_html:

body: We all know that users here (myself included) will actually seek out guilds categorized as "offensive". Hell, I might change my category to offensive just to get more views, if I can get by with it. That's what most of us are here for......to be offensive and see offensive crap. You're actually arguing against getting more traffic by curious viewers

parent.body:
omg the world must be collapsing

i agree with milkit :o

the fact that certain categories (and guilds therefore) are going to be hidden by default in *All* concerns me

also, the "offensive" category and the arbitrary categories in general

plus the fact that this completely undermines the purpose of the website imo

I think it would be wiser (and more consistent with Ruqqus) to nurture a more diverse community, instead of barring some people from being heard

body:
If it was enabled by default then maybe, but its still a work around for something that does not make sense to be in place for ALL anyway. That is what your home view should be and IMHO the place where dev work should be focused for an enhanced experience. Many of us use ALL because the home view is lacking and because sometimes we want to see all content

Fyi my political related guilds do not have a political category assigned to them now.

parent.body:
I don't think a master switch "show all" or "unfiltered" would be an issue. That leaves it up to the user.

"show all categories" checkbox that checks all. Since uncategorized has now been applied to all guilds that haven't been categorized.

I don't think a master switch "show all" or "unfiltered" would be an issue. That leaves it up to the user.

"show all categories" checkbox that checks all. Since uncategorized has now been applied to all guilds that haven't been categorized.

body:
Drama is going to have drama.  However, "bitching" is an example of feedback, even though the criticism can be very non-constructive.  Either you can take it with a grain of salt, or ignore it.

BTW, can we stop using "beta" as a response when the "software" works fine.  The issue is some people don't agree with the admin, not the status of software.
body_html:
Drama is going to have drama. However, "bitching" is an example of feedback, even though the criticism can be very non-constructive. Either you can take it with a grain of salt, or ignore it.

The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body:
I mean I'm personally here because I hate censorship. I just want to speak freely, and want others to as well 

I think the decision to exclude a lot of these guilds from *All* compromises that goal. But I understand the logic behind this decision too

Captain wants to make the website more accessible, and doesn't want it to become a cesspool, as free-speech platforms often do 

but i think there are better ways to accomplish that

body:
>Many of us use ALL because the home view is lacking and because sometimes we want to see all content

I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

>Fyi my political related guilds do not have a political category assigned to them now.

Your concern is those guilds are now under the "uncategorized" category because their GMs haven't switched them to a more appropriate cat?

![](https://i.ibb.co/Z2F3hY9/image.png)

![](https://i.ibb.co/JR364Vm/image.png)

Rough mockups I did with inspect element above.
body_html:
Many of us use ALL because the home view is lacking and because sometimes we want to see all content

I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

Fyi my political related guilds do not have a political category assigned to them now.

Your concern is those guilds are now under the "uncategorized" category because their GMs haven't switched them to a more appropriate cat?

Rough mockups I did with inspect element above.

post.body:
As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

>Many of us use ALL because the home view is lacking and because sometimes we want to see all content

I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

>Fyi my political related guilds do not have a political category assigned to them now.

Your concern is those guilds are now under the "uncategorized" category because their GMs haven't switched them to a more appropriate cat?

![](https://i.ibb.co/Z2F3hY9/image.png)

![](https://i.ibb.co/JR364Vm/image.png)

Rough mockups I did with inspect element above.

parent.body:
Drama is going to have drama.  However, "bitching" is an example of feedback, even though the criticism can be very non-constructive.  Either you can take it with a grain of salt, or ignore it.

BTW, can we stop using "beta" as a response when the "software" works fine.  The issue is some people don't agree with the admin, not the status of software.

Software is never complete, and will always change, unless it's a **final** release.  This includes functionalities, that will always be changing, thus never finalized.

Anyways, I was referring to usage of the software status, when it has nothing to do with the core functionality of the software, but the plans of how a new feature is implemented.

I find the phrases "it's still in early access" or "it's still in beta", doesn't support the cause, but rather is a filler response that adds nothing to the conversation.  I seens this going back to the game H1Z1, and even before that.

body:
I think there are better ways to accomplish that, too. But I still find myself defending the admins more than not. I know there are legit complaints. I'm not blind to that. But there's a lot of knee jerk reactions happening, as well. People are jumping on too many bandwagons way too quickly, instead of being patient. And they're not giving the admins time to grow and learn from the overall experience...which they will. They're not idiots. If they were, we wouldn't be here. In a year, I guarantee none of this will matter and everything will be different. 

That being said, I've just decided this is my last comment on how the site is run and the overall controversy. It's not getting me anywhere. And no matter what I say, some idiots downvote me for not jumping on the admin bandwagon hate-fest. It's pointless when a year from now, none of this will even be an issue. Hell, I give it six months.
body_html:

And they're not giving the admins time to grow and learn from the overall experience...which they will. They're not idiots. If they were, we wouldn't be here. In a year, I guarantee none of this will matter and everything will be different.

That being said, I've just decided this is my last comment on how the site is run and the overall controversy. It's not getting me anywhere. And no matter what I say, some idiots downvote me for not jumping on the admin bandwagon hate-fest. It's pointless when a year from now, none of this will even be an issue. body:
ill weigh in on this.

for ruqqus to survive beyond the cringe and be a competitor to reddit, it has to be pg 13 on the front end and rated R in the back end.

there is a difference between censorship and have an inviting front end for normal people to look a cats and engage hobbyist guilds while giving the fringe a censor free platform.

you gotta accept a balance between the sales pitch and the machine to get this beast on the highway.

some of you are to young to remember but there was a time porn was only on VHS and almost every movie rental store had a curtain for the adult entertainment in the back, the front end was family friendly and you could let your kids roam about and pick a movie for movie night while a parent slipped behind the curtain to grab a few after hours entertainment.

some of you are getting your panties in a twist cuz your adult entertainment wanting to be displayed in the front window for all to see but that chases away the normal people.
how the fuck you think voat didnt survive? it displayed all the cringe and surprise, only the cringe showed up.

i personally click all and trending trying to find interesting stuff and i get bombarded by cartoon porn and 13 year old racial cringe.
its fucking annoying to block guild after guild after guild.

parent.body:
>It's people being upset that others are being given the option to not look at them.

No, it's not. I don't agree with them entirely, but you don't have to misrepresent what they're saying...

They're upset that these categories are opt-in only. If you just look at /all without interacting with the page, there's no way to tell that some categories are hidden. There's no "Welcome to All! Go to the sidebar to choose the categories you want to see!" message, there's no description above the category list, and there's really nothing else to indicate that some categories are not visible by default. The listing's name is "All", so why wouldn't the average user assume that all categories are visible by default? There's not even a way to check these hidden categories on mobile. That's what they're upset about. They want all the categories to be opt-out (I don't necessarily agree, but that's fine), which means others *still have the option to not look at them*.

They're also upset about your response to all this. I also think it's much of an overreaction, but I dislike seeing that you're actually banning them from your guilds for making posts about this. I'm talking about @FeverDream and the others. That looks much like shutting down dissent, and it's better to just make replies saying something like "We're going to change the categorization system so it is clearer that certain categories are going to be hidden by default. We apologize for rushing the feature." or "We won't force the offensive category on any guilds, even if we do think the guild is offensive." rather than kicking the posts and banning the authors.

Also, as for the "offensive" category, they're worried about the subjectivity of the name of the category.

I'd prefer to have /all stay as a place where all guilds are visible and to have the Home feed for logged out users and a new listing (called something like "Custom") use the categorization system, but that's just my preference.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

post.body:
As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body:
And what will be this "pg 13 frontend"? Are you going to anoint privileged "defaults" like Reddit did? Sweep the wrongthink under the carpet? All speech is to be treated equally, said the admin. The administration provides the tools and the final burden falls on the users to filter what they want. If your user crowd wants the "cringe", the "cringe" will be popular and more visible, under fair and objective rules.

Normal people don't like freedom and responsibility. It's a tough sell in the first place.

parent.body:
ill weigh in on this.

for ruqqus to survive beyond the cringe and be a competitor to reddit, it has to be pg 13 on the front end and rated R in the back end.

there is a difference between censorship and have an inviting front end for normal people to look a cats and engage hobbyist guilds while giving the fringe a censor free platform.

you gotta accept a balance between the sales pitch and the machine to get this beast on the highway.

some of you are to young to remember but there was a time porn was only on VHS and almost every movie rental store had a curtain for the adult entertainment in the back, the front end was family friendly and you could let your kids roam about and pick a movie for movie night while a parent slipped behind the curtain to grab a few after hours entertainment.

some of you are getting your panties in a twist cuz your adult entertainment wanting to be displayed in the front window for all to see but that chases away the normal people.
how the fuck you think voat didnt survive? it displayed all the cringe and surprise, only the cringe showed up.

i personally click all and trending trying to find interesting stuff and i get bombarded by cartoon porn and 13 year old racial cringe.
its fucking annoying to block guild after guild after guild.

some of you are to young to remember but there was a time porn was only on VHS and almost every movie rental store had a curtain for the adult entertainment in the back, the front end was family friendly and you could let your kids roam about and pick a movie for movie night while a parent slipped behind the curtain to grab a few after hours entertainment.

some of you are getting your panties in a twist cuz your adult entertainment wanting to be displayed in the front window for all to see but that chases away the normal people.
how the fuck you think voat didnt survive? it displayed all the cringe and surprise, only the cringe showed up.

i personally click all and trending trying to find interesting stuff and i get bombarded by cartoon porn and 13 year old racial cringe.
its fucking annoying to block guild after guild after guild.

ill weigh in on this.

for ruqqus to survive beyond the cringe and be a competitor to reddit, it has to be pg 13 on the front end and rated R in the back end.

post.body:
As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body: I think a better idea would have been using the categories to make a more diversified front page, so that you couldn't be accused of censorship but would make the site more approachable. (e.g. limit it to one politics post, one meme post, one news post, one entertainment post etc) That way the "offensive" stuff would be able to have one or two posts on the front page, but other content would also show up.

>Many of us use ALL because the home view is lacking and because sometimes we want to see all content

I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

>Fyi my political related guilds do not have a political category assigned to them now.

Your concern is those guilds are now under the "uncategorized" category because their GMs haven't switched them to a more appropriate cat?

![](https://i.ibb.co/Z2F3hY9/image.png)

![](https://i.ibb.co/JR364Vm/image.png)

Rough mockups I did with inspect element above.

Many of us use ALL because the home view is lacking and because sometimes we want to see all content

I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

Fyi my political related guilds do not have a political category assigned to them now.

body:
> This category shit should not be applied to ALL to filter OUT content.

Good point. I like the example provided by [Pleroma](https://freespeechextremist.com/main/all?utm_source=amerika.org):

* My Timeline: people I follow and myself 
* Interactions: like our replies/mentions here
* Direct messages: we don't have those
* Public timeline: people on my local node
* The Whole Known Network: everything and everyone all at once (fun but chaotic)

Are you really that fucking dense? They should not have to search for my specific content if they don't know it exists using search functionality that is horrible. This category shit should not be applied to ALL to filter OUT content. Its called ALL for a reason. We are perfectly capable of filtering out anything we dont want to by guild or user already. This just gives the admins the rights to dictate what is seen. Maybe the drama queens have been correct about all of this. Looking like the same shit that reddit did.

If my requests from early on in the site had been implemented, by allowing us to build our own home view with guilds of our choosing , none of this would have even been necessary. But that has been ignored

post.body:
As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body:
> I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

And this is exactly why I made the recommendation multiple times to let us customize a home view with just the guilds we wish to see (in addition to subscribed ones) while leaving ALL alone when we want to see it all.

> Your concern is those guilds are now under the "uncategorized" category because their GMs haven't switched them to a more appropriate cat?

No. My concern is that I had to change my guilds to a totally unrelated category so  they could be seen at all. If they aren't seen they don't grow. If they aren't seen they are not found.
body_html:
I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

And this is exactly why I made the recommendation multiple times to let us customize a home view with just the guilds we wish to see (in addition to subscribed ones) while leaving ALL alone when we want to see it all.

Your concern is those guilds are now under the "uncategorized" category because their GMs haven't switched them to a more appropriate cat?

No. My concern is that I had to change my guilds to a totally unrelated category so they could be seen at all. If they aren't seen they don't grow. If they aren't seen they are not found.

parent.body:
>Many of us use ALL because the home view is lacking and because sometimes we want to see all content

I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

>Fyi my political related guilds do not have a political category assigned to them now.

Your concern is those guilds are now under the "uncategorized" category because their GMs haven't switched them to a more appropriate cat?

![](https://i.ibb.co/Z2F3hY9/image.png)

![](https://i.ibb.co/JR364Vm/image.png)

Rough mockups I did with inspect element above.
parent.body_html:
Many of us use ALL because the home view is lacking and because sometimes we want to see all content

I get the point of using /all, but a lot of us want to be able to use /all without sifting through content that doesn't interest us. And categories help with that.

Fyi my political related guilds do not have a political category assigned to them now.

Your concern is those guilds are now under the "uncategorized" category because their GMs haven't switched them to a more appropriate cat?

Rough mockups I did with inspect element above.

As seen here https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/64sd/captainmeta4-doesnt-like-being-called-out/lbfo the admins were planning on discussing a rework to the "Offensive" category. The changelog post cap made today was 3 hours after this making it safe to assume that the offensive rework discussion hadn't happened yet. The thing about how these responses seem to work is they don't respond till a solution if found (correct me if I'm wrong but I'm pretty sure this is a part time thing for most if not all the admins also but don't quote me on that). That being said they obviously aren't blind so I'd make a bet that within the next few days there would be some kind of new rework done to the categories, silence does not mean they are ignore the problem, they are clearly aware of it; I'd like a response to but patience is important, you ain't the world to them and not every programmer/admin is an obese neck beard with endless time.

That being said, the whole changing category  to offensive in "solidarity" that's being spearheaded by +TheGreatReset just sound cheesy, like I mean come on it's a fucking beta software shit doesn't work well all the time.

body:
> Regarding your first quote; if every guild has a category and there is an "select all" option, that means /all is effectively the same as before. Right?

It would be but the logical change would be to do it the opposite way by allowing those to opt-in by choosing the categories they wish to see and by keeping all content shown by default if they do not. This option makes the most sense for new users because they do see all content at first and can filter from there if desired. Or you can focus the dev work on the user home view to customize it by guild, or category, and leave ALL alone.

I would also extend categories to the guild searches  to allow searches by category.

I understand why you think this is necessary as some of the content and users here are abhorrent. We already have means to deal with them if we don't want to see it and many see this change as the admins imposing censorship instead of the ideals of free speech. The free speech solution would be by allowing your userbase to opt in to filtering, by their choice,  instead of having to opt out.
body_html:
Regarding your first quote; if every guild has a category and there is an "select all" option, that means /all is effectively the same as before. Right?

It would be but the logical change would be to do it the opposite way by allowing those to opt-in by choosing the categories they wish to see and by keeping all content shown by default if they do not. This option makes the most sense for new users because they do see all content at first and can filter from there if desired. Or you can focus the dev work on the user home view to customize it by guild, or category, and leave ALL alone.

I would also extend categories to the guild searches to allow searches by category.

I understand why you think this is necessary as some of the content and users here are abhorrent. We already have means to deal with them if we don't want to see it and many see this change as the admins imposing censorship instead of the ideals of free speech. The free speech solution would be by allowing your userbase to opt in to filtering, by their choice, instead of having to opt out.

parent.body:
> Regarding your first quote; if every guild has a category and there is an "select all" option, that means /all is effectively the same as before. Right?

It would be but the logical change would be to do it the opposite way by allowing those to opt-in by choosing the categories they wish to see and by keeping all content shown by default if they do not. This option makes the most sense for new users because they do see all content at first and can filter from there if desired. Or you can focus the dev work on the user home view to customize it by guild, or category, and leave ALL alone.

I would also extend categories to the guild searches  to allow searches by category.

I understand why you think this is necessary as some of the content and users here are abhorrent. We already have means to deal with them if we don't want to see it and many see this change as the admins imposing censorship instead of the ideals of free speech. The free speech solution would be by allowing your userbase to opt in to filtering, by their choice,  instead of having to opt out.
parent.body_html:
Regarding your first quote; if every guild has a category and there is an "select all" option, that means /all is effectively the same as before. Right?

It would be but the logical change would be to do it the opposite way by allowing those to opt-in by choosing the categories they wish to see and by keeping all content shown by default if they do not. This option makes the most sense for new users because they do see all content at first and can filter from there if desired. Or you can focus the dev work on the user home view to customize it by guild, or category, and leave ALL alone.

I would also extend categories to the guild searches to allow searches by category.

I understand why you think this is necessary as some of the content and users here are abhorrent. We already have means to deal with them if we don't want to see it and many see this change as the admins imposing censorship instead of the ideals of free speech. The free speech solution would be by allowing your userbase to opt in to filtering, by their choice, instead of having to opt out.

parent.body:
>It's people being upset that others are being given the option to not look at them.

No, it's not. I don't agree with them entirely, but you don't have to misrepresent what they're saying...

They're upset that these categories are opt-in only. If you just look at /all without interacting with the page, there's no way to tell that some categories are hidden. There's no "Welcome to All! Go to the sidebar to choose the categories you want to see!" message, there's no description above the category list, and there's really nothing else to indicate that some categories are not visible by default. The listing's name is "All", so why wouldn't the average user assume that all categories are visible by default? There's not even a way to check these hidden categories on mobile. That's what they're upset about. They want all the categories to be opt-out (I don't necessarily agree, but that's fine), which means others *still have the option to not look at them*.

They're also upset about your response to all this. I also think it's much of an overreaction, but I dislike seeing that you're actually banning them from your guilds for making posts about this. I'm talking about @FeverDream and the others. That looks much like shutting down dissent, and it's better to just make replies saying something like "We're going to change the categorization system so it is clearer that certain categories are going to be hidden by default. We apologize for rushing the feature." or "We won't force the offensive category on any guilds, even if we do think the guild is offensive." rather than kicking the posts and banning the authors.

Also, as for the "offensive" category, they're worried about the subjectivity of the name of the category.

I'd prefer to have /all stay as a place where all guilds are visible and to have the Home feed for logged out users and a new listing (called something like "Custom") use the categorization system, but that's just my preference.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
